alert.note: Alert for Dallam; Hartley; Sherman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 14 at 2:05PM CST until December 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND NORTHWEST TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND NORTHWEST TEXAS PANHANDLE... * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron and Texas. In Texas... Dallam...Sherman and Hartley. * 20 Foot Winds...Today, southwest 15 to 25 mph with gust up to 40 mph. Wednesday, southwest 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. * Relative Humidity...Today, as low as 12 percent. Wednesday, as low as 9 to 12 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...Today, values between 1 and 2 are expected across a majority of the Panhandles, with values of 3 and 4 possible in the western Oklahoma Panhandle and northwest Texas Panhandle. Wednesday, values between 3 and 7 are expected across a majority of the Panhandles, with values of 8 possible in the Oklahoma and northern Texas Panhandles. * Timing...Through the late afternoon hours. Wednesday morning through the late afternoon hours.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
